page.title: 02BROADBAY SOUTH, TONG S.S.S.I
page.content:
{Tong Saltings}was first notified as a Site of Special Scientific Interest in 1974. The site contains one of the largest areas of{saltmarsh}and tidal flats in the Western Isles. A wide variety of{habitats}are represented including lowland grassland, peatland, open waters, sand dunes, sand and shingle spit, and intertidal flats.
The site is important for wintering, breeding and feeding birds including waders, tern, and wildfowl.
The largest areas of saltmarsh cover over 100 hectares and comprise two distinct units, the larger of which is the western marsh (about 80 hectares). The two areas are not outstanding in a national context but are important locally and regionally.
